prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8. [info] The headline reads: Cohdopian Embassy staff Member, Manny Coachen, Found Not Guity!
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell. [info] Victim
Byrne Faraday (Age: 40)
Mack Rell (Age: 32)

Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard.


Remarks About the Bodies
Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: From this, it is obvious that Mr. Faraday died after he shot Mr. Rell.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: And Mr. Rell, while on the brink of death, stole Mr. Faraday's knife and stabbed him.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: They struggled, and Mr. Rell used the last of his strength to counterattack Mr. Faraday.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those are the facts of this case.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to pick one pair where the evidence contradicts a testimony.

First, let me look through the testimonies. The ones here are all from Franziska. Let's go through each testimony and see if any evidence conflicts with them.

Testimony 0 says Faraday died instantly, Rell survived a bit. Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) mentions Faraday died of a knife stab, Rell from a bullet wound. The notes also state that Rell was shot from a few yards away. The time of death is around 4 PM for both, discovered immediately after a gunshot. Wait, if Rell was shot from a distance, then he couldn't have been close enough to stab Faraday right after being shot. Because if Rell was shot from a few yards away, he would have been injured, but the lack of gunpowder burns indicates the shooter was not at point-blank. So Rell would have been shot first, then maybe Faraday was stabbed? But Testimony 1 says Faraday died after shooting Rell. Hmm.

Testimony 1: Faraday died after shooting Rell. So the order is Faraday shoots Rell, then Faraday dies. But if Rell was shot and then stabbed Faraday, how does that fit? Let's check the evidence. Evidence 3 is the handgun found in Faraday's hand, but the bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away. If Faraday shot Rell, he would have been a few yards away. Then, according to Testimony 3 and 2, Rell, on the brink of death, stole Faraday's knife and stabbed him. But the knife (Evidence 4) was found in Rell's hand and was the weapon used to kill Faraday. So if Faraday was stabbed by Rell after Rell was shot, then Faraday would have died after Rell. But Testimony 0 says Faraday died instantly, Rell survived for a short time. Wait, that seems conflicting. If Faraday was stabbed after Rell was shot, then Rell would have to be alive to stab Faraday. But Rell was shot from a distance, so he's the one who got shot first. Then, Rell, even though he's dying, stabs Faraday. But the time of death is the same for both. So the order would be Faraday shoots Rell, then Rell stabs Faraday. Both die around the same time. But Testimony 1 says Faraday died after shooting Rell, which aligns. But the contradiction might be in how the stabbing occurred.

Wait, looking at Evidence 5: Faraday died of a knife stab, Rell of a bullet wound. The bullet was fired from a few yards away. So Faraday was the shooter. But if Faraday was holding the gun (Evidence 3), then he shot Rell from a distance. Then, Rell, after being shot, takes Faraday's knife and stabs him. But if Rell was shot from a distance, he would have to approach Faraday to stab him. But if he's already shot and dying, can he move? Also, the knife (Evidence 4) was found in Rell's hand. But the problem comes from the fact that the bullet was fired from a few yards away. So Faraday shot Rell, then Rell, while dying, took the knife and stabbed Faraday. However, Testimony 2 says Rell stole the knife and stabbed Faraday. But the key contradiction might be with the fact that the knife can transform into the Yatagarasu's key (Evidence 16). Wait, maybe that's a stretch. Alternatively, the fact that the knife was found in Rell's hand (Evidence 4) and that the gun was found in Faraday's hand (Evidence 3). If Rell was shot first, then he couldn't have physically taken the knife from Faraday if Faraday was holding the gun. Unless they were in a struggle. But the evidence says the bullet was from a few yards away, which suggests Faraday was not close to Rell when he shot him. Therefore, after being shot, Rell would have to move towards Faraday to stab him, which might not be possible if he's mortally wounded. So Testimony 3 says they struggled, but if the shot was from a distance, there might not have been a struggle. So perhaps the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (they struggled) and Evidence 3 (bullet from a few yards away). Because if they struggled, they would be close, but the bullet was fired from a distance. Therefore, Testimony 3 claiming they struggled contradicts Evidence 3 indicating the shot was from a distance. So the evidence is 3 (Handgun) and testimony 3 (Franziska's Testimony 3 about the struggle). That seems like a contradiction because a struggle implies close proximity, but the bullet was fired from a few yards away, so no close contact during the shooting.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. So, I need to look through the testimonies given, compare them with the evidence provided, and find a direct contradiction.

First, looking at the testimonies. Most of them are from Franziska. Let me check each one. Testimony 3 says that Faraday and Rell attacked each other at the same time from close range. But according to the evidence, maybe there's something that contradicts this close range part.

Looking at Evidence 3: The handgun found in Faraday's hand. The bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away. Also, Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) mentions that Rell's clothes have no gunpowder burns, which supports that he was shot from a distance. So if Franziska's testimony claims the attack was from close range, but the evidence shows the gunshot was from a few yards away, that's a contradiction.

So Testimony 3 (Franziska stating close range) contradicts Evidence 3 or Evidence 5. Let me check the exact wording. Evidence 3 says the bullet was fired from a few yards away. Evidence 5 also states the same. Therefore, Testimony 3's assertion of close range is contradicted by these evidences. The correct pair would be whichever evidence directly addresses the distance. Evidence 3 is the handgun evidence that mentions the bullet was fired from a few yards. So pairing Evidence 3 with Testimony 3 makes sense. Alternatively, Evidence 5's remarks about Rell's clothes also support this. But the testimony is about the attack being from close range, while the evidence shows the gunshot was from a distance, which is impossible if they were attacking each other at close range. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 3 or 5. Let me check the exact evidence numbers. The question says to output one pair. Evidence 3's description mentions the bullet was fired from a few yards, which directly contradicts Testimony 3's statement of close range. So the correct answer would be evidence 3 and testimony 3.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So the task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidence, and testimonies. I need to look through each testimony and check if any evidence directly contradicts it.

Looking at the testimonies first. Testimony 3 from Yew says that Rell was killed out of necessity and set up to look like they killed each other. The setup implies that they were made to appear as if they killed each other. So if the evidence shows that they couldn't have killed each other, that would contradict the testimony.

Now looking at the evidence. Evidence 3 is the handgun found in Faraday's hand. But the bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away. If Faraday was stabbed (as per Evidence 5), he couldn't have shot Rell from a distance. Also, the handgun was found in Faraday's hand, but he was already dead from a stab wound. So if Rell was shot from a distance, the killer had to be someone else, not Faraday. Therefore, the setup that they killed each other is impossible. This contradicts Yew's Testimony 3 which claims the setup was to make it look like mutual killing. Therefore, Evidence 3 (Handgun) contradicts Testimony 3.
